title: Complete Vietnam Travel Guide
text:
Vietnam is a captivating Southeast Asian country that stretches along the eastern coast of the Indochinese Peninsula. From the misty mountains of Sapa to the bustling streets of Ho Chi Minh City, from the ethereal beauty of Ha Long Bay to the lantern-lit ancient town of Hoi An, Vietnam offers an unforgettable journey through history, culture, and natural wonders.

HANOI - THE CAPITAL:
Hanoi, Vietnam's capital, seamlessly blends French colonial architecture with traditional Vietnamese culture. The Old Quarter is the heart of Hanoi, with 36 ancient streets named after the goods historically sold there. Each narrow street bustles with motorbikes, street vendors, and sidewalk cafes serving traditional Vietnamese coffee.

Don't miss Hoan Kiem Lake at dawn when locals practice tai chi. Visit Ngoc Son Temple on the lake's island, connected by the iconic red Huc Bridge. The lake is beautiful year-round but especially magical during sunset.

For food, try bún chả (grilled pork with noodles) at Bún Chả Hương Liên where Obama dined, phở at Phở Gia Truyền, and egg coffee at Café Giảng, a Hanoi specialty invented in the 1940s.

HA LONG BAY - NATURAL WONDER:
Ha Long Bay, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, features thousands of limestone karsts rising from emerald waters. This otherworldly seascape is best experienced on an overnight cruise. Choose a 2-3 day cruise to explore hidden caves, go kayaking through floating villages, and watch sunrise over the karsts.

Best time: March to May and September to November. Avoid summer monsoons and winter fog. Book reputable cruises with small groups for better experience.

HOI AN - ANCIENT TOWN:
Hoi An Ancient Town is Vietnam's most romantic destination. This 2000-year-old trading port is remarkably well-preserved, with yellow buildings, colorful lanterns, and riverside cafes. Car-free streets make it perfect for walking or cycling.

Get custom clothes made in 24 hours at one of hundreds of tailors. Visit the iconic Japanese Covered Bridge, explore ancient merchants' houses, and take a lantern-making workshop. Every full moon, the town celebrates with a lantern festival - magical!

Must-try food: cao lầu (Hoi An noodles), bánh mì at Bánh Mì Phượng, white rose dumplings, and evening food at the Night Market.

HO CHI MINH CITY (SAIGON):
Vietnam's largest city pulses with energy. Visit the War Remnants Museum for sobering Vietnam War history, the beautiful Notre-Dame Cathedral and Central Post Office showcasing French colonial architecture, and the underground Cu Chi Tunnels used during the war.

Ben Thanh Market is a must for souvenirs and street food. For nightlife, head to Bui Vien Street or rooftop bars like Chill Skybar. Food highlights include bánh xèo (crispy pancakes), bún riêu (crab noodle soup), and fresh seafood in District 4.

MEKONG DELTA:
The Mekong Delta, Vietnam's rice bowl, offers a glimpse into rural Vietnamese life. Take a boat trip through floating markets like Cai Rang (near Can Tho), visit fruit orchards, and stay in a homestay. Try elephant ear fish and lots of tropical fruits.

CENTRAL VIETNAM BEACHES:
Da Nang has beautiful beaches and the incredible Marble Mountains. My Khe Beach is one of the world's most beautiful. Visit the Golden Bridge held by giant stone hands at Ba Na Hills.

Nha Trang is party central with beaches, water sports, and vibrant nightlife. Mui Ne offers red and white sand dunes perfect for sunrise watching and sandboarding.

SAPA AND NORTHERN MOUNTAINS:
Sapa's terraced rice fields are stunning from September to October (harvest) and May to June (green season). Trek through ethnic minority villages, stay in homestays, and climb Fansipan, Indochina's highest peak (now accessible via cable car).

PRACTICAL INFORMATION:
Visa: E-visa available for 90 days for most nationalities ($25)
Currency: Vietnamese Dong (VND). 1 USD ≈ 24,000 VND
Best time: February-April (warm, less rain) or October-December
Getting around: Domestic flights are cheap, overnight buses and trains connect major cities
Apps: Grab for taxis, Google Maps works well
Safety: Very safe for tourists. Watch belongings in crowded areas
Food: Street food is safe and delicious. Drink bottled or boiled water

FOUR-DAY ROMANTIC ITINERARY:

Day 1: Hanoi
Morning: Hoan Kiem Lake, Old Quarter walk
Afternoon: Temple of Literature, Vietnam Museum of Ethnology
Evening: Water puppet show, dinner cruise on West Lake

Day 2: Ha Long Bay
Full day overnight cruise: kayaking, cave exploration, tai chi on deck at sunrise

Day 3: Hoi An
Morning: Arrive from Ha Long/Hanoi, hotel check-in
Afternoon: Ancient town walking tour, Japanese Bridge, tailor visit
Evening: Riverside dinner, lantern release on Thu Bon River

Day 4: Hoi An
Morning: Cooking class or beach time at An Bang Beach
Afternoon: Basket boat ride, final old town exploration
Evening: Rooftop dinner watching lanterns light up the town

BUDGET TIPS:
Accommodation: $10-30 for mid-range, $100+ for luxury
Meals: Street food $2-5, restaurants $10-20
Transport: Grab rides $2-10, domestic flights $30-100
Activities: Most temples/sites $2-5 entry

Vietnam offers incredible value, rich culture, delicious food, and some of Southeast Asia's most stunning landscapes. Whether you're looking for adventure, romance, history, or relaxation, Vietnam delivers it all with warm hospitality and unforgettable experiences.
